_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



This is a newly constructed anhydrous ammonia storage facility located at the same address as a previous anhydrous ammonia storage facility that was removed in 2007.  This facility is strictly a retail storage facility.  This current RMP is submitted as a Program 3 due in whole to OSHA's July 22nd, 2015, rescission of an exemption given to retail fertilizer facilities from the requirements of OSHA Process Safety Management.



1)  The Facility Policy



The owners, management, and employees of K & B Ag Supply, LLC, are committed to the prevention of any accident releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Linn County Emergency Management Agency, the LEPC, the Fairfax Volunteer Fire Department, and other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2)  Facility Information



This facility was decommissioned in 2007 when all anhydrous ammonia storage tanks were removed from the facility.  The current facility is a re-introduction of anhydrous ammonia bulk storage.  The sole process occurring at this facility will be the storage & handling of anhydrous ammonia for retail sale to farmers as a crop nutrient.



3)  The Five-Year Accident History



In the last 5 years, there have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.



4)  The Emergency Action Plan



The facility has:

a)  a written Emergency Action Plan, in accordance with the OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

b)  provided state and local authorities the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know information as required under SARA Title II (EPCRA);

c)  responses will be coordinated with Linn County Emergency Management / LEPC (PBX: 319-892-6500) and the Fairfax Volunteer Fire Department (PBX: 911).



5)  Planned Changes to Improve Safety



The facility is newly constructed under current IDALS regulations & ANSI standards.  Cons

truction has also utilized best practices learned from the operation and management of three other anhydrous ammonia storage facilities owned by our sister companies.  Safety will be an on-going process at this facility.  Daily inspections and periodic evaluations of the entire system will be performed to confirm safe operating conditions are being maintained.  A process hazard analysis and regular reviews will be conducted and, when necessary for the improvement of the system, changes will be made.  However, at this time, there are no new / additional safety recommendations or plans for system improvement.
